==English== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|en|/wɛm/}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|en|enm|wem}}, {{m|enm|wemme}}, from {{inh|en|ang|wamm|t=stain, spot, scar, disgrace, defect, defilement, sin, evil, crime, injury, loss, hurt, misfortune}}, from {{inh|en|gem-pro|*wammaz|t=stain, spot}}, from {{der|en|ine-pro|*wemh₁-|t=to spew, vomit}}. Cognate with {{cog|is|vamm||loss, damage}}, {{cog|la|vomō||vomit|pos=verb}} ({{cog|en|vomit}}), {{etyl|grc|en}} {{m|grc|ἐμέω||I spew}} ({{cog|en|emesis}}), {{cog|lt|vemti||to vomit}}, {{cog|sa|वमति||to vomit}} ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|en|weam}}, {{l|en|weem}} * {{l|en|wame}}, {{l|en|wan}} {{qualifier|Scotland}} ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|UK|_|dialectal}} A [[spot]], [[stain]], or [[mark]]; {{lb|en|by extension}} a ([[moral]]) [[blemish]] or [[fault]]. #* '''1822''', sir Walter Scott (bart [novels, collected]), ''Historical romances of the author of Waverley'', page 513: #*: "It is even so," he added, as he gazed on the Sub-Prior with astonishment; "neither '''wem''' nor wound — not so much as a rent in his frock!" #* '''1936''', Blanche Mary Kelly, ''The Well of English'' #*: {{...}} but it is a perfect illustration of the vision which haunted Blake all his days,—the vision of Paradise, an earthly Paradise in which there is neither '''wem''' nor wrinkle, which basks in the radiance of its own innocence. # {{rfv-sense|en}} {{lb|en|UK|_|dialectal}} [[neglect|Neglect]]; [[damage]]. ====Derived terms==== * {{l|en|wemless}} * {{l|en|wemmy}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|en|enm|wemmen}}, from {{inh|en|ang|wemman|t=to defile, besmirch, profane, injure, ill-treat, destroy, abuse, revile}}, from {{inh|en|gem-pro|*wammijaną|t=to stain}}, from {{der|en|ine-pro|*wem-|t=to spew, vomit}}. ====Verb==== {{en-verb|wemm}} {{rfv|en}} # {{lb|en|transitive|UK|_|dialectal}} To [[injure]] or [[disfigure]]; [[blemish]]; [[mark]]; [[scar]]. # {{lb|en|transitive|UK|_|dialectal}} To [[defile]]; [[pollute]]; [[corrupt]]; [[vitiate]]. # {{lb|en|transitive|UK|_|dialectal}} To [[violate]] (one's word). ====Derived terms==== * {{l|en|wemmed}} * {{l|en|wemming}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=emw|MWE|Mew|mew}} ---- ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/veːm/}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun form}} # {{lb|de|interrogative}} {{inflection of|de|wer||dat}}, ([[to]]) [[whom]] (''indirect object''). ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
